alert.note: Alert for Saginaw; Shiawassee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 3:39PM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Shiawassee River At Owosso affecting Saginaw and Shiawassee Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Shiawassee River At Owosso. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to a crest of 7.5 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Impact...Minor flooding is likely along portions of the river. Any moving ice chunks in the river can do damage or cause ice jams which could result in rapid fluctuations of river level. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
